text:
Jmter can be run via proxy with arguments --proxyHost and –proxyPort. Additionally, we can set ‘no proxy’ option for special hosts with: --nonProxyHosts.

That generally works fine for me.

But it doesn’t work when I send HTTP request ('Follow Redirects' option is set) via Jmeter that is being redirected (302) and this redirection is from ‘proxy’ domain to ‘no-proxy’ domain. 

It seems to me that the second request has still proxy settings the same as first one even though it should be changed per Jmeter configuration.

The same scenario with redirection between proxy/no-proxy works fine in Chrome and FoxyProxy extension.

Am I missing something here or is it Jmeter limitation?
creator: m.sierzputowski@gmail.com
